step.cmd: In the Machines drop-down list box, select a machine.
step.stepresult: The Open page appears, displaying a list of operations for the selected machine.

step.cmd: In the Open page, select a clocked-on operation.
step.stepresult: The Documents section appears, displaying the documents associated with the operation.
The NCM page opens, displaying a list of defects associated with the selected operation.
The Create Non Conformance window appears.

step.cmd: In the Create Non Conformance window, specify the options as described in the following table.

row.entry: Enter a summary for the defect. A value is required in this field.
Refer to the non-conformance type of the defect as Manufacture Defect. This field is read-only.
Select the type of defect associated with the BOM part of the operation.

Select the reason for creating the defect in the material associated with the operation. Use the reason tree to specify the reason for the defect, and then select Apply.You must configure the defect reason tree in the Plant Applications Administrator, and then link that defect reason tree for selection in the Operations application by using a script file.
Enter a detailed description of the defect in the BOM part associated with an operation.

step.stepresult: A defect is created on the operation, and the operation is put on hold. The operation on hold appears in the On Hold page in the Operations application.

taskbody.result: The defect appears in the NCR Management application. For more information about disposing a defect, refer to the topic.
